newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Mastercard sees 30 pct higher Latam revenue in '97.
newsitem.headline: Mastercard sees 30 pct higher Latam revenue in '97.

text.p: MasterCard International sees its Latin American revenues growing by 30 percent this year against 1996, a top company official said Thursday.
"We expect revenue in the region to grow 30 percent over that of last year," Richard Child, the credit card company President for Latin America told journalists.
He added that regional revenue in 1996 was about $22 billion in credit business and $6-7 billion in debit business.
Brazil, Argentina and Mexico, in that order, account for 80 percent of Latin American revenues, Child said.
He was in Argentina to launch the World Mastercard and Premium Class credit cards -- already launched in other countries -- aimed at higher purchase-level clients.
Child said credit card usage in Argentina is one of the world's highest: "Argentina is very fond of credit cards."
Argencard, owned by international investment fund and holding company Exxel Group, has the license to issue MasterCard credit cards in Argentina and Uruguay.
